intro: Achyrocline leptocephala, commonly known as the narrow-headed achyrocline, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to saline environments, making it a halophyte. Its small, white to pale blue flowers are arranged in clusters, and it produces small, elongated fruits. The species is of interest in ecological studies due to its role in coastal ecosystems and its potential medicinal properties.
